item.title: If the future of Ethereum is going to be ZK: please put big bug bounties for ZK. No hacker would stop what he is doing for 50k. If the future of Ethereum depends on 50k bounties we have a problem.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description:
If the future of Ethereum is going to be ZK: please put big bug bounties for ZK. No hacker would stop what he is doing for 50k. If the future of Ethereum depends on 50k bounties we have a problem.

item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: I would also add "roughly comparable UX."
One of the main reasons privacy hasn't caught on yet is because, in the current state, it almost always means higher cost and worse UX. This naturally limits the number of use cases where privacy is practical. But as this gap narrows, a solution with privacy will always win against a solution without.
item.dc:creator: @bobbinth
item.description:
I would also add "roughly comparable UX."

One of the main reasons privacy hasn't caught on yet is because, in the current state, it almost always means higher cost and worse UX. This naturally limits the number of use cases where privacy is practical. But as this gap narrows, a solution with privacy will always win against a solution without.

item.title: RT by @fede_intern: gm. we’re solving preconfirmations and based rollups with friends. once we have something working we will launch a first testnet without proving. then with proving.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description: gm. we’re solving preconfirmations and based rollups with friends. once we have something working we will launch a first testnet without proving. then with proving.

item.title:
Part of the @class_lambda engineering team that is building ethrex is working onsite with @gattacahq/@titanbuilderxyz on a project we’ll announce in the coming weeks that will be useful for multiple parties and Ethereum in general. We made the decision to go work on site after a short dinner with Kubi from Gattaca and a few hours later the team flew from Buenos Aires to London. I couldn’t go, I’m in Abu Dhabi closing some deals that hopefully will help bring more companies and users to Ethereum.
Today I had two calls with two CEOs and we’re gonna work on other initiatives with their teams to help accelerate Ethereum. As they say, “only the paranoid survive.” We plan to turn this small crisis around and ensure that the best protocol humanity has ever created continues to win.
A big thank you to @drakefjustin for coming onsite to speak with both teams about the beam chain, preconfirmations, base, and native rollups.
Let’s go Ethereum! Let’s fight back and win, we can do it.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description:
Part of the @class_lambda engineering team that is building ethrex is working onsite with @gattacahq/@titanbuilderxyz on a project we’ll announce in the coming weeks that will be useful for multiple parties and Ethereum in general. We made the decision to go work on site after a short dinner with Kubi from Gattaca and a few hours later the team flew from Buenos Aires to London. I couldn’t go, I’m in Abu Dhabi closing some deals that hopefully will help bring more companies and users to Ethereum.

Today I had two calls with two CEOs and we’re gonna work on other initiatives with their teams to help accelerate Ethereum. As they say, “only the paranoid survive.” We plan to turn this small crisis around and ensure that the best protocol humanity has ever created continues to win.

A big thank you to @drakefjustin for coming onsite to speak with both teams about the beam chain, preconfirmations, base, and native rollups.

Let’s go Ethereum! Let’s fight back and win, we can do it.

item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: Rigorous scalable decentralization gives us durable disintermediation and durable censorship resistance. This is why Metropolitan Ethereum is the best currently viable platform on which to rearchitect all the world's systems, bottom up, on the sounder foundations of decentralized trust and decentralized finance.
We are on the path to sufficient horizontal and vertical scalability, and will continue to massively improve.
We have achieved tx and block/blob-space affordability, and will continue to massively improve.
We have achieved decent usability, and will continue to massively improve this via intents-based architectures and AI agent assistance.
And it is now legal to do crypto/blockchain in the USA. Technically it always was, but the previous government ran a secret and not-so-secret inquisition which cast a deep pall over the space, which kept talent and businesses away.
As we are seeing, creative people are now powerfully attracted to our space to make use of Web3 primitives in their startups and businesses. The talent is swarming and the applications are coming. Soon every person, community and business on the planet will have interesting, fun, and productive things to do on Web3 -- the re-decentralized world wide web.
item.dc:creator: @ethereumJoseph
item.description:
Rigorous scalable decentralization gives us durable disintermediation and durable censorship resistance. This is why Metropolitan Ethereum is the best currently viable platform on which to rearchitect all the world's systems, bottom up, on the sounder foundations of decentralized trust and decentralized finance.

We are on the path to sufficient horizontal and vertical scalability, and will continue to massively improve.

We have achieved tx and block/blob-space affordability, and will continue to massively improve.

We have achieved decent usability, and will continue to massively improve this via intents-based architectures and AI agent assistance.

And it is now legal to do crypto/blockchain in the USA. Technically it always was, but the previous government ran a secret and not-so-secret inquisition which cast a deep pall over the space, which kept talent and businesses away.

As we are seeing, creative people are now powerfully attracted to our space to make use of Web3 primitives in their startups and businesses. The talent is swarming and the applications are coming. Soon every person, community and business on the planet will have interesting, fun, and productive things to do on Web3 -- the re-decentralized world wide web.

nitter.freedit.eu/lex_node/status/1884740971339841994#m

item.title: We have been coding in Rust since 2014 professionally. For us the best code is no code, the second best code is the dumb and simple one.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description:
We have been coding in Rust since 2014 professionally. For us the best code is no code, the second best code is the dumb and simple one.
